name: NPR
text:
A federal judge has ordered the Trump administration to fully restore DACA and begin accepting new applications as soon as Monday. 

An estimated 300,000 undocumented youth in the U.S. would be eligible for its protection.

text: The Trump campaign and allied Republicans have lost legal challenges to overturn results in six states. "We don't need courts," Rudy Giuliani told Fox News, arguing state lawmakers can just declare Trump the winner. https://t.co/9vQhkk1sEr

text: Opinion: The history of presidential pardons is often surprising ‚Äî and revealing, says @nprscottsimon. https://t.co/clyDQSUQA4

text: A massive fire gutted a historic Manhattan church home to "New York's Liberty Bell," which rang out to mark the birth of the U.S. in 1776. https://t.co/Oj1UFRtqEB

text:
Kinston, N.C., is known for producing more NBA players than anywhere else in the country and the boy's team is often in the spotlight. Yet, the girls' team wins just as often as the boys.

text: How do you get people to follow proper COVID-19 safety measures? Psychology says that it often comes down to choosing the right words. https://t.co/Dg8G2Wc0ya

text:

text: California's acting public health officer: "Staying home for three weeks is a sacrifice, but if every Californian did that for a month, we could stop this disease in its tracks." https://t.co/2JSPTFzafE

text: Nearly 85% of California residents will soon be under a stay-at-home order through Christmas, as coronavirus cases surge and capacity inside ICUs plunges toward dangerously low levels. https://t.co/5epuyRhqWO
